Questions.QuestionString: Hydraulic pressure can be restored by. (Level 2)
Answers: compressing the air charge in an accumulator.
the use of a pressure/heat exchanger.
compressing the fluid in a reservoir.

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the temperature overheat switch located in a hydraulic pump?. (Level 2)
What happens if a component has an internal hydraulic leak?. (Level 2)
Accumulators as fitted to aircraft hydraulic systems. (Level 2)
Answers: are only ever used in an emergency.
provide additional fluid if leaks occur.

Questions.QuestionString: A Skydrol hydraulic fluid seal would be made of. (Level 2)
Answers: butyl rubber, ethylene propylene or Teflon.

Questions.QuestionString: The control of hydraulically powered emergency electrical generator frequency is by. (Level 2)
When flushing hydraulic systems. (Level 2)
When replenishing a hydraulic system. (Level 2)
Answers: use any hydraulic fluid made by the same manufacturer.

Questions.QuestionString: When is an hydraulic de-pressurising valve energised?. (Level 2)
Answers: When there is sufficient hydraulic pressure available.

Questions.QuestionString: What constitutes a hydraulic power pack?. (Level 2)
If an accumulator loses air pressure there will be. (Level 2)
A thermal relief valve is fitted to an hydraulic system to. (Level 2)
Answers: prevent a leak back of pressure.

Questions.QuestionString: A component in a hydraulic system which ensures instantaneous action when a service is selected is. (Level 2)
Restrictor valves in an hydraulic system are used to. (Level 2)
Answers: restrict the rate of pressure build up.
control the rate of system operation.

Questions.QuestionString: The purpose of a mechanical sequence valve is to ensure the operation of. (Level 2)
The purpose of a non-return valve is to. (Level 2)
Answers: direct fluid to the hydraulic actuator.

Questions.QuestionString: The end fittings on a NRV are normally different to. (Level 2)
Answers: allow a full flow from the valve.

Questions.QuestionString: Automatic cut-out valve hammering is caused by. (Level 2)

Pressure relay valves are fitted. (Level 2)

Answers: provide a reserve of stored energy.
minimize the possibility of pump cavitation.

Questions.QuestionString: In aircraft hydraulic systems, it is permissible to use. (Level 2)
Answers: any fluid of the same specific gravity.

Questions.QuestionString: Hydraulic systems are normally flushed with. (Level 2)
Answers: the same type of fluid as used in the system.

Questions.QuestionString: A RAT hydraulic pump is for. (Level 2)
Answers: flying controls if hydraulic power lost.

Questions.QuestionString: A purpose of a 'cut-out' in a hydraulic system. (Level 3)
Answers: is to prevent creep in jack operated services which have several selected positions.
is to limit loss of fluid in the event of pipe fracture.
is to relieve the pump of load when the operation of services is complete and the accumulator charged with fluid.

Questions.QuestionString: A maintainer valve in an hydraulic system will. (Level 3)
Answers: allow continued press to essential systems during times of reduced supply.
maintain a high pressure to all systems.

Questions.QuestionString: How is the hydraulic pump depressurising solenoid actuated?. (Level 3)
Answers: Energised both open and closed depending on cockpit selection.

Questions.QuestionString: A normal hydraulic system will. (Level 3)
Answers: show pressure and source of hydraulics.
illuminate a light in the cockpit when the system is ready.

Questions.QuestionString: A constant volume hydraulic system uses what to relieve pressure in system when no services are being used?. (Level 3)
A pressure control relay in a hydraulic pump is. (Level 3)
Answers: used to prevent anything happening until there is hydraulic pressure.

Questions.QuestionString: A duplex seal consist of. (Level 3)
Answers: a square section rubber ring within a steel washer.
a hard rubber square section ring with a soft rubber square section inner ring.
a rubber 'T' section ring sandwiched between two Teflon rings.

Questions.QuestionString: A fixed volume axial pump contains the following rotating parts. (Level 3)
Answers: Drive Shaft, Swash Plate & Valve Block.
Drive Shaft, Swash Plate & Cylinder Block.

Questions.QuestionString: An hydraulic closed system is one where. (Level 3)
Answers: pressure is maintained at the selector valves at all times.
there is no pressure at the selector valves when no functions are required.
most of the major components of the system are included in a self contained unit.

Questions.QuestionString: A marker number on a pipe indicates. (Level 3)
Answers: the thickness of the wall on the pipe.
the specification of the pipe throughout the pipe run.
the type of fluid used to pressure test the pipe.

Questions.QuestionString: "One reason for fitting an accumulator in an hydraulic system is to." (Level 3)
Answers: minimize the possibility of pump cavitation.

Questions.QuestionString: A shuttle valve is used for. (Level 3)
Answers: preventing fluid loss from a leaking jack.
maintaining fluid press when the emergency system fails.
change over from main to auxiliary system in the case of failure.

Questions.QuestionString: A hydraulic accumulator is charged with initial air pressure of 1000 PSI. When the hydraulic system pressure of 3000 PSI is reached, the air pressure is. (Level 3)
Constant delivery hydraulic pumps. (Level 3)
Answers: require an automatic cut-out valve in the system.
require an automatic cut-out valve and accumulator in the system.

Questions.QuestionString: Before checking the initial pressure in the hydraulic accumulator. (Level 3)
Answers: the reservoir must be checked for correct level.
the fluid pressure must be released.
all air must be bled from the system.

Questions.QuestionString: The essential components of a hydraulic system of the constant delivery type are an. (Level 3)
A maintaining valve is fitted to a hydraulic system. (Level 3)
Answers: to maintain a back pressure to the accumulator.
to ensure a supply of fluid to essential services in the event of system failure.

Questions.QuestionString: To enable an hydraulic system to operate two components requiring different pressures. (Level 3)
Answers: a pressure reducing valve is used.
a pressure regulating valve is used.
a pressure relief valve is used.
